data.name: Main Stay Therapeutic Farm
data.description:
Main Stay’s mission is to enrich mind, body and spirit through powerful connections with horses, animals and nature.

Located in Richmond, IL, Main Stay is a non-profit organization that offers adaptive horseback riding, equine and animal-assisted learning activities and adaptive gardening programs to individuals with physical, developmental, behavioral, emotional and social challenges.

Main Stay enriches the lives of their clients in a caring, safe, and challenging environment that enables them to reach their full potential.
data.enriched_summary: Main Stay Therapeutic Farm is a therapeutic farm that offers adaptive/therapeutic riding programs for individuals, families, and groups. They aim to enrich mind, body, and spirit through powerful connections with horses, animals, and nature.
data.metadata_title: Main Stay Therapeutic Farm - Inspiring Unbridled Joy
data.metadata_description: Main Stay Therapeutic Farm is dedicated to children & adults with physical, developmental, emotional and social challenges.

updates.description:
Looking for a meaningful, screen-free way to connect with your child? 

Join Main Stay’s Parent & Child Horsemanship Lessons! 🐴 
 
This 4-week, hands-on course is the perfect opportunity for one caring adult and one child (ages 7+) to spend quality time together, learn new skills, and enjoy the power of connection with horses. 

- Lessons take place on Mondays, beginning on October 27, 2025 from 4-5 p.m.
- Cost is $175 per child (adult attends free!)
- Small group size: just 4 child-adult pairs for a supportive experience

👉  For more information and to register, please visit: 
https://lnkd.in/gUZUkvf6

Spots are limited! Registration closes October 20, 2025, or once all spots are filled. 

Please note, you do not have to be a parent to attend! Any caring adult is welcome: parent, grandparent, aunt, uncle, older sibling, or guardian. The program is designed for one adult and one child to share the experience together.

If you're at the farm and enjoying a walk on our wellness trail, you will probably see some new garden beds along the path. These are the start of some no-till garden beds! 

Why Choose No-Till Beds Over Traditional Tilling?

Tilling the soil to plant can stir up dormant weed seeds and disrupt the delicate soil environment that nature is creating. No till beds utilize cardboard, well aged compost, and mulch to smother weeds and create a nutrient rich environment for new plants. It takes a whole season for the ingredients to break down, but the waiting can be worth it. We plan to use our new beds to create pocket prairies along the wellness trail in 2026!

Our butterfly bush is in full bloom, attracting Monarchs, Red Admirals, and even the Hummingbird Clearwing Moth! 

While butterfly bushes provide a tasty nectar stop, it is our native plants like milkweed, coneflowers, and asters that give butterflies the essential habitat they need to complete their life cycles. These native plants can be found throughout the farm, including in our adaptive garden!

You're invited! Join us at the farm on Friday, October 24, 2025, from 6-9 p.m. for SINGO, our lively spin on music and bingo for all ages. The evening will also include a chance to win exciting raffle baskets! Delicious dinner options, along with drinks and treats will be available for purchase at the farm from MJ’s Coffee Bar Food Truck. 

Tickets are $25/person or 4 tickets for $85 -- Tap the link below to get your tickets today! 
https://lnkd.in/gnsFndDT

Main Stay has partnered with McHenry County College to offer Horsemanship Lessons! 🐴 

This 6-week course, starting Monday, October 6, is designed for individuals new to horses who want to learn from the ground up, no riding involved. Whether you are just curious about horses or considering future riding, this is a great place to start your journey. Sessions are facilitated by a PATH Intl. certified instructor and supported by trained volunteers.
 
Tap the link below to learn more or to sign up!
https://lnkd.in/gZHBMBBu

Discover the language of horses in a supportive, hands-on environment! 🐴 

Main Stay will be offering its 6-week Horsemanship Lessons, with lessons beginning Wednesday, September 17. Lessons are designed for individuals who are new to horses and want to learn from the ground up -- no riding involved!

Through groundwork-based sessions facilitated by a PATH Intl. certified instructor and supported by trained volunteers, participants will gain confidence, safety awareness, and a meaningful connection with our horses. Groups are kept small—typically 4 to 6 participants—to ensure a supportive and engaging learning environment.
If you are interested in participating, please fill out the online interest form by September 8, and a member of our program team will reach out to you to begin the registration process: https://lnkd.in/d9pQtujr

#Horsemanship

They're almost ready! 🍅 
The tomatoes at the farm are almost ready to turn red. There are a lot of factors that effect tomatoes changing color from green to red such as light, temperature, nutrients, and overall plant health. Typically August is when we see the tomatoes change color here at the farm.
 
Have any tomato growing tips? Feel free to share in the comments below!

During a recent session, one of our senior clients — who lives with limited mobility — was exploring how different energy levels could affect connection with our animals. Lia, ever thoughtful and self-aware, acknowledged that her natural calm presence can be hard to shift. 

Then she asked, “Can I try something? It’s going to be loud.”

We said yes.

Lia launched into the most beautiful, robust song, her voice filling the Littles’ north arena, which, it turns out, has incredible acoustics! Instantly, all 14 of the animals — goats, sheep, minis, donkey, and mule — turned toward her in still, rapt attention. Ollie the goat even rested his head gently on Jerry the sheep’s shoulder, completely absorbed in the music.

It was one of those rare, magical moments of pure connection and calm. 💚 

#HeartwarmingMoments #MusicMagic

Confidence counts. When kids read to calm, nonjudgmental animals, they have more fun and more motivation to grow their literacy skills! 

Featured on WGN News, Main Stay's Books in the Barnyard blends nature, animals and reading for all levels. Sessions are designed by a certified educator and adapted to your curriculum -- from vocabulary-building for younger readers to student-authored stories “published” to our animal audience. Single or multi-visit options are available year-round for groups of all ages and reading abilities! See it in action on WGN: https://lnkd.in/g56QD8FP

Ready to schedule? Fill out our interest form online to get started: https://lnkd.in/ghsJPhkp

Join us at the farm on Thursday, September 4, 2025, from 6:00-7:30 p.m. for Yoga in the Garden - a calming evening of gentle yoga in Main Stay’s adaptive garden. Led by certified yoga instructor Denise Jordan, this all-levels class is designed for participants of all abilities, offering a perfect opportunity to relax and rejuvenate! 100% of the proceeds will benefit Main Stay Farm.

Cost is $25 per person. Register online at: https://lnkd.in/gmhhYap5

Registration required by Tuesday, September 2. Please bring your own mat, blanket, and pillow.

SINGO is almost here; have you registered yet? Register now: https://lnkd.in/gnsFndDT

Join us Friday, October 24th, from 6–9 PM at the farm for an evening of music, bingo, and family-friendly fun! Enjoy delicious dinner options, drinks, and treats available for purchase from MJ’s Coffee Bar Food Truck, as well as a chance to win exciting raffle baskets!

Funds raised from this event will support our Animal Care Fund, helping provide daily care for our herd and purchasing of additional program horses.

Tickets are $25 per person OR 4 tickets for $85. 

A huge thank you to our amazing sponsors for making this event possible! 

Herd Heroes: 
- Ameriprise Financial
- Anonymous
- Morrissey Family Businesses

Animal Care Champions:
- Anonymous 
- Eccezion
- GAD Consulting LLC 
- Rechel Septic 

Stable Supporters:
- First Secure State Banks 
- Heritage Woods of McHenry 
- TurnKey Digital
- Visiting Angels

Come experience the magic and beauty of Main Stay Farm! 

Visit our website at www.mainstayfarm.org for more information or to contact us to tour the farm and learn more about how you can support our misson!
Riding backwards gives our riders a different sensory experience while also providing some good core workout. Most importantly it usually brings out some big smiles! 😊

Led by certified yoga instructor Denise Jordan, this all-levels class is designed for participants of all abilities, offering a perfect opportunity to relax and rejuvenate! 100% of the proceeds will benefit Main Stay Farm.

Cost is $25 per person. Register online at: https://lnkd.in/gmhhYap5

Registration required by Tuesday, September 2. Please bring your own mat, blanket, and pillow.

We are VERY excited to share that the endangered rusty-patched bumblebee paid a visit to Main Stay this week! 🐝 

On Wednesday, August 6, we were lucky enough to see (and capture photos of!) this vital pollinator hard at work, pollinating flowers here at the farm. A big shout-out to our staff and volunteers who care for the garden and ensure it is a safe space for all creatures.

Sightings like this reaffirm our commitment to conservation. By placing our land in a conservation easement with the Land Conservancy of McHenry County in 2014, we have ensured that these 40 acres will remain protected for pollinators, wildlife, and our community for generations to come.

The rusty-patched bumblebee was listed as a federally endangered species by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service in 2017. 

#EndangeredSpecies

Happy National Sunflower Day! 🌻

Sunflowers remind us to grow with purpose, face the light, and keep reaching -- even on cloudy days. At Main Stay, we see that same spirit in those we serve. Like sunflowers, they turn toward possibility and never stop reaching toward what’s possible.

“Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and the shadows will fall behind you.” — Walt Whitman

See Me, For Me: Meet Erin!

If you have spent time around the farm, chances are you have seen Erin -- she has been riding at Main Stay for 30 years! When she is at the farm, Erin looks forward to riding her horse, Kay, outside on nice weather days. Trotting is her favorite as Erin has a definite need for speed!

Right now, Erin is working toward a big goal: holding the reins to steer and stop Kay on her own. It's not always easy though. Keeping her posture straight while managing the reins can be challenging and, at times, frustrating. But Erin’s determination does not waver. In fact, her proudest moments are when she accomplishes things all by herself! Her instructor Mikki shared:

"Erin always gives her best when she shows up to ride! You can really see her dedication to riding and she always pushes herself to grow. She also has a big heart and always asks how everyone is doing, who someone new is, and where a team member is if they aren't there that day. She also knows every Disney song and will proudly sing the best lines when we play music in class! It's an honor to teach and learn from Erin and her class is always a bright part of the day!"

When she is not at the farm, you might find Erin enjoying one of her favorite hobbies, bowling! She also scuba dives and is an excellent swimmer. But above all, there is one thing Erin wishes everyone knew about her: she can be really silly!

Whether she is reaching her goals in the arena or zooming around in her orange power chair, Erin is a joyful reminder that determination can help us overcome even the toughest challenges, while still being silly along the way.
Learn more about Erin, and see her, for her at: https://lnkd.in/gJB3JxxF

Watch Main Stay on Fox 32 Chicago TODAY at 12:15 PM! 📺 

Hear about the special partnership with Main Stay and Meridian Health. 
During the segment, we will be sharing the incredible benefits of all programs at the farm—adaptive riding, equine and animal-assisted learning, and gardening—and how our special animals and beautiful land impact the lives of Meridian's clients and everyone who comes to the farm.

Main Stay received two grants from Meridian Health to bring Equine and Animal Assisted Learning programs to their youth and senior clients and gather data on how animal-assisted learning improves mental health.

Main Stay is incredibly proud to be a sponsor of HLC Therapy Group’s Disability Pride Event 2025, the first event of its kind in the Chicago suburbs.

At Main Stay, supporting Disability Pride is more than a sponsorship to us, it is a reflection of our core values: celebrating individuals for who they are, supporting how they want to grow, and empowering people of all abilities. 

Hosted by Downtown Crystal Lake, this celebration honors the beauty, diversity, and lived experiences of people with disabilities. All are invited to join the celebration this Saturday, July 26, from 11 AM to 1 PM in the Grant Street Parking Lot. This free event will include performers, local vendors, and resource booths, highlighting the diverse voices within the disability community. This Saturday also marks the 35th anniversary of the passing of the federal Americans with Disabilities Act.

For more information, please visit https://lnkd.in/gAKUCgum

They're almost ready! 🍅 
The tomatoes at the farm are almost ready to turn red. There are a lot of factors that effect tomatoes changing color from green to red such as light, temperature, nutrients, and overall plant health. Typically August is when we see the tomatoes change color here at the farm.
 
Have any tomato growing tips? Feel free to share in the comments below!

Then she asked, “Can I try something? It’s going to be loud.”

We said yes.

Lia launched into the most beautiful, robust song, her voice filling the Littles’ north arena, which, it turns out, has incredible acoustics! Instantly, all 14 of the animals — goats, sheep, minis, donkey, and mule — turned toward her in still, rapt attention. Join us at the farm on Thursday, September 4, 2025, from 6:00-7:30 p.m. for Yoga in the Garden - a calming evening of gentle yoga in Main Stay’s adaptive garden. Led by certified yoga instructor Denise Jordan, this all-levels class is designed for participants of all abilities, offering a perfect opportunity to relax and rejuvenate! 100% of the proceeds will benefit Main Stay Farm.

Cost is $25 per person. Register online at: https://lnkd.in/gmhhYap5

Registration required by Tuesday, September 2. Please bring your own mat, blanket, and pillow.

We are VERY excited to share that the endangered rusty-patched bumblebee paid a visit to Main Stay this week! 🐝 

On Wednesday, August 6, we were lucky enough to see (and capture photos of!) this vital pollinator hard at work, pollinating flowers here at the farm. A big shout-out to our staff and volunteers who care for the garden and ensure it is a safe space for all creatures.

Sightings like this reaffirm our commitment to conservation. By placing our land in a conservation easement with the Land Conservancy of McHenry County in 2014, we have ensured that these 40 acres will remain protected for pollinators, wildlife, and our community for generations to come.

The rusty-patched bumblebee was listed as a federally endangered species by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service in 2017. 

#EndangeredSpecies

Happy National Sunflower Day! 🌻

Sunflowers remind us to grow with purpose, face the light, and keep reaching -- even on cloudy days. At Main Stay, we see that same spirit in those we serve. Like sunflowers, they turn toward possibility and never stop reaching toward what’s possible.

“Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and the shadows will fall behind you.” — Walt Whitman

See Me, For Me: Meet Erin!

If you have spent time around the farm, chances are you have seen Erin -- she has been riding at Main Stay for 30 years! When she is at the farm, Erin looks forward to riding her horse, Kay, outside on nice weather days. Trotting is her favorite as Erin has a definite need for speed!

Right now, Erin is working toward a big goal: holding the reins to steer and stop Kay on her own. It's not always easy though. Keeping her posture straight while managing the reins can be challenging and, at times, frustrating. But Erin’s determination does not waver. In fact, her proudest moments are when she accomplishes things all by herself! Her instructor Mikki shared:

"Erin always gives her best when she shows up to ride! You can really see her dedication to riding and she always pushes herself to grow. She also has a big heart and always asks how everyone is doing, who someone new is, and where a team member is if they aren't there that day. She also knows every Disney song and will proudly sing the best lines when we play music in class! It's an honor to teach and learn from Erin and her class is always a bright part of the day!"

When she is not at the farm, you might find Erin enjoying one of her favorite hobbies, bowling! She also scuba dives and is an excellent swimmer. But above all, there is one thing Erin wishes everyone knew about her: she can be really silly!

Whether she is reaching her goals in the arena or zooming around in her orange power chair, Erin is a joyful reminder that determination can help us overcome even the toughest challenges, while still being silly along the way.
Learn more about Erin, and see her, for her at: https://lnkd.in/gJB3JxxF

During the segment, we will be sharing the incredible benefits of all programs at the farm—adaptive riding, equine and animal-assisted learning, and gardening—and how our special animals and beautiful land impact the lives of Meridian's clients and everyone who comes to the farm.

Main Stay received two grants from Meridian Health to bring Equine and Animal Assisted Learning programs to their youth and senior clients and gather data on how animal-assisted learning improves mental health.

Main Stay is incredibly proud to be a sponsor of HLC Therapy Group’s Disability Pride Event 2025, the first event of its kind in the Chicago suburbs.

At Main Stay, supporting Disability Pride is more than a sponsorship to us, it is a reflection of our core values: celebrating individuals for who they are, supporting how they want to grow, and empowering people of all abilities. 

Hosted by Downtown Crystal Lake, this celebration honors the beauty, diversity, and lived experiences of people with disabilities. All are invited to join the celebration this Saturday, July 26, from 11 AM to 1 PM in the Grant Street Parking Lot. This free event will include performers, local vendors, and resource booths, highlighting the diverse voices within the disability community. This Saturday also marks the 35th anniversary of the passing of the federal Americans with Disabilities Act.

For more information, please visit https://lnkd.in/gAKUCgum

We are incredibly grateful to be among the 2025 Annual Competitive Grant recipients! Thank you to The Community Foundation for McHenry County for your continued support of our mission and for helping us make a lasting difference in McHenry County. 💚
updates.reshared_post_author: The Community Foundation for McHenry County
updates.reshared_post_description:
🎉 Exciting News!
We’re proud to announce our 2025 Annual Competitive Grant recipients!
The Community Foundation for McHenry County has awarded over $700,000 in grant and scholarship funding through our annual competitive grant cycle. These investments reflect our continued commitment to strengthening McHenry County through strategic, local philanthropy.

👏 Congratulations to all the incredible organizations and students receiving support this year!

✨ There’s truly nothing more rewarding than investing in our community’s future. Read more at https://lnkd.in/gGeeS5eY 

#mchenrycountyil #CommunityImpact #localphilanthropy

updates.description:
The farmstand is officially open! 🌻 

When you visit the farm be sure to stop by the cart with the big sunflower wheels by the front entrance. Produce grown in our adaptive garden is available for free to anyone visiting the farm. Items will change based on the harvest season, but each one will be labeled. It’s a great time to try a new vegetable! 

A big thank you to the Main Stay Garden Team, all volunteers, for working so hard in the garden!

"Horses understand the world in ways that humans often forget..."

Happy World Horse Day to our incredible herd — and every horse around the world! We are endlessly grateful for the joy, connection, and many lessons our equine partners continue to share with us. 🐴 

#WorldHorseDay2025

Happy National Sunflower Day! 🌻

Sunflowers remind us to grow with purpose, face the light, and keep reaching -- even on cloudy days. At Main Stay, we see that same spirit in those we serve. Like sunflowers, they turn toward possibility and never stop reaching toward what’s possible.

“Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and the shadows will fall behind you.” — Walt Whitman

See Me, For Me: Meet Erin!

If you have spent time around the farm, chances are you have seen Erin -- she has been riding at Main Stay for 30 years! When she is at the farm, Erin looks forward to riding her horse, Kay, outside on nice weather days. Trotting is her favorite as Erin has a definite need for speed!

Right now, Erin is working toward a big goal: holding the reins to steer and stop Kay on her own. It's not always easy though. Keeping her posture straight while managing the reins can be challenging and, at times, frustrating. But Erin’s determination does not waver. In fact, her proudest moments are when she accomplishes things all by herself! Her instructor Mikki shared:

"Erin always gives her best when she shows up to ride! You can really see her dedication to riding and she always pushes herself to grow. She also has a big heart and always asks how everyone is doing, who someone new is, and where a team member is if they aren't there that day. She also knows every Disney song and will proudly sing the best lines when we play music in class! It's an honor to teach and learn from Erin and her class is always a bright part of the day!"

When she is not at the farm, you might find Erin enjoying one of her favorite hobbies, bowling! She also scuba dives and is an excellent swimmer. But above all, there is one thing Erin wishes everyone knew about her: she can be really silly!

Whether she is reaching her goals in the arena or zooming around in her orange power chair, Erin is a joyful reminder that determination can help us overcome even the toughest challenges, while still being silly along the way.
Learn more about Erin, and see her, for her at: https://lnkd.in/gJB3JxxF

Watch Main Stay on Fox 32 Chicago TODAY at 12:15 PM! 📺 

Hear about the special partnership with Main Stay and Meridian Health. 
During the segment, we will be sharing the incredible benefits of all programs at the farm—adaptive riding, equine and animal-assisted learning, and gardening—and how our special animals and beautiful land impact the lives of Meridian's clients and everyone who comes to the farm.

Main Stay received two grants from Meridian Health to bring Equine and Animal Assisted Learning programs to their youth and senior clients and gather data on how animal-assisted learning improves mental health.

Main Stay is incredibly proud to be a sponsor of HLC Therapy Group’s Disability Pride Event 2025, the first event of its kind in the Chicago suburbs.

At Main Stay, supporting Disability Pride is more than a sponsorship to us, it is a reflection of our core values: celebrating individuals for who they are, supporting how they want to grow, and empowering people of all abilities. 

Hosted by Downtown Crystal Lake, this celebration honors the beauty, diversity, and lived experiences of people with disabilities. All are invited to join the celebration this Saturday, July 26, from 11 AM to 1 PM in the Grant Street Parking Lot. This free event will include performers, local vendors, and resource booths, highlighting the diverse voices within the disability community. This Saturday also marks the 35th anniversary of the passing of the federal Americans with Disabilities Act.

For more information, please visit https://lnkd.in/gAKUCgum
POV: When your co-worker says they brought donuts 👀 😋

We are incredibly grateful to be among the 2025 Annual Competitive Grant recipients! Thank you to The Community Foundation for McHenry County for your continued support of our mission and for helping us make a lasting difference in McHenry County. 💚
updates.reshared_post_author: The Community Foundation for McHenry County
updates.reshared_post_description:
🎉 Exciting News!
We’re proud to announce our 2025 Annual Competitive Grant recipients!
The Community Foundation for McHenry County has awarded over $700,000 in grant and scholarship funding through our annual competitive grant cycle. These investments reflect our continued commitment to strengthening McHenry County through strategic, local philanthropy.

👏 Congratulations to all the incredible organizations and students receiving support this year!

✨ There’s truly nothing more rewarding than investing in our community’s future. Read more at https://lnkd.in/gGeeS5eY 

#mchenrycountyil #CommunityImpact #localphilanthropy

updates.description:
The farmstand is officially open! 🌻 

When you visit the farm be sure to stop by the cart with the big sunflower wheels by the front entrance. Produce grown in our adaptive garden is available for free to anyone visiting the farm. Items will change based on the harvest season, but each one will be labeled. It’s a great time to try a new vegetable! 

A big thank you to the Main Stay Garden Team, all volunteers, for working so hard in the garden!

"Horses understand the world in ways that humans often forget..."

Happy World Horse Day to our incredible herd — and every horse around the world! We are endlessly grateful for the joy, connection, and many lessons our equine partners continue to share with us. 🐴 

#WorldHorseDay2025

Thank you to WGN and Ana Belaval for highlighting the inspiring partnership between Main Stay and Meridian Health. We are incredibly grateful for the opportunity to share the transformative benefits of the programs offered at our farm and how our special animals and beautiful land impact the lives of Meridian's clients and everyone who comes to the farm! 💚
updates.reshared_post_description:
We had the incredible opportunity to welcome Ana Belaval and the WGN-TV Morning News crew to Main Stay Therapeutic Farm for a special Around Town live broadcast! 

Together, Main Stay, Meridian, and YouthCare HealthChoice Illinois shared the healing power of therapeutic farming, the joy of animal-assisted interventions, and the meaningful impact our programs have on our members.

📺 Watch our segments here: https://bit.ly/4knR1Vr

We’re so grateful to the amazing Ana and the WGN team for capturing the spirit of our shared efforts and why it makes a difference.

#NonprofitProfessionals

Have you purchased your tickets yet for our annual Come Together Gala? TOMORROW is the last day to take advantage of our early bird ticket price - $75/ticket (when purchased online only). Prices increase to $100/ticket on June 1st.

Get your tickets today at MainStayFarm.org/Gala

We can’t wait to see you at the farm on Thursday, June 26! Doors open at 5:30 pm.

Questions about the event? View our Come Together Gala FAQ page at MainStayFarm.org/Gala-FAQ or contact Randi at rmurawski@mainstayfarm.org

You are cordially invited! Join us at the farm on Thursday, June 26, 2025, from 5:30-9:30 p.m. for our annual Come Together Gala! Tickets are on sale now at: mainstayfarm.org/gala

Enjoy a thoughtfully crafted menu inspired by American Southwest favorites, bid on an array of popular and unique items in our silent auction, win a bottle of high-end wine or spirits in our signature Pony Pull, and enjoy rich guitar sounds by International Fingerstyle Guitar Champion, Jack Wilson! And, of course, embrace the excitement with the drawing for Main Stay’s Triple Crown Raffle! As the event draws to a close and the sun begins to set, enjoy s’mores around the campfire and farm tours.

ONLINE TICKET SPECIAL: $75/ticket when purchased ONLINE ONLY through May 31st. Tickets will be $100 starting June 1st - get your tickets now at mainstayfarm.org/gala

Please join us for this signature event at the farm to support Main Stay’s mission to enrich mind, body and spirit through powerful connections with horses, animals and nature.

Registration closes on Friday, June 6th. 

CASH BAR ONLY | Summer Casual Attire 

For additional information, please contact us at gala@mainstayfarm.org or give us a call at 815-653-9374.

We are thrilled to announce that Main Stay has been recognized at the 31st Annual Communicator Awards with an Award of Excellence for Kay's Holiday Card! 

Presented by the Academy of Interactive & Visual Arts (AIVA), the Communicator Awards is one of the largest and most competitive programs honoring excellence in marketing, communication, and creative work. We are incredibly proud that Kay’s Holiday Card was celebrated alongside entries from organizations such as NASA+, Netflix, Apple, and The Walt Disney Company. It is a true honor to be recognized among such respected industry leaders.

We are especially proud to recognize the creative talents behind the card: Randi Murawski, Main Stay’s Communications Manager, who thoughtfully designed and crafted the card’s message, and Haley Cronin, one of our dedicated Instructors, who took the beautiful photos of Kay in the snow. Their collaboration captured Kay’s winter spirit in a way that clearly resonated far and wide!

To view the full list of winners and learn more about the competition, please visit: https://lnkd.in/g4e4XhV2

***
About The Communicator Awards
The Communicator Awards recognizes excellence, effectiveness and innovation across all areas of communication. For 31 years, the platform has provided an equal opportunity for companies, agencies, organizations and independent creators to be honored, regardless of team size or project budget. 
The awards are judged by the Academy of Interactive & Visual Arts (AIVA), an invitation-only body of over 500 industry leaders from top brands and agencies. This year’s Jury included professionals from Google, Accenture Song, Smithsonian, Microsoft, Digitas, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Publicis, Spotify, Johns Hopkins, Critical Mass, Amazon, The Andy Warhol Museum and many more. For more, visit aiva.org.

Thank you to CBS News Chicago for highlighting the inspiring partnership between Main Stay and Meridian Health on “Jump Start with Jackie”. 

We are incredibly grateful for the opportunity to share the transformative benefits of the programs offered at our farm, and how our special animals and beautiful land impact the lives of Meridian's clients and everyone who comes to the farm.  

If you missed the segment this morning, you can watch it here: https://lnkd.in/gqExaKr6

See Me, For Me: Leah

Leah has been riding at Main Stay for nearly 37 years - a journey that began when she was just seven years old. Now at 44, she continues to ride in our Adaptive Riding program, with the same joy and determination.
Over the past year, she has made big strides in strength and communication, even returning to trotting again during her lessons. Her instructor Haley shared:

“I have loved watching Leah get stronger over the past year! She is strong enough to stay centered and balanced enough that we have been able to trot again during lessons! Leah has also been talking more, letting the leader know the color of the next pole or cone and even letting us know who is singing next in The Lion King! I'm excited that the weather is getting nice again, because she loves to ride outside and steer Harry over the tracks!"

Despite the frustration of not always being able to express herself verbally, it is the kindness and love that Leah receives that keeps her moving to new heights. Like her favorite Disney princesses, Leah carries a magic all her own - a spirit that speaks louder than words ever could.

Learn more about Leah, and see her, for her at: https://lnkd.in/deHYFJQA

"Horses understand the world in ways that humans often forget..."

Happy World Horse Day to our incredible herd — and every horse around the world! We are endlessly grateful for the joy, connection, and many lessons our equine partners continue to share with us. 🐴 

#WorldHorseDay2025

Thank you to WGN and Ana Belaval for highlighting the inspiring partnership between Main Stay and Meridian Health. We are incredibly grateful for the opportunity to share the transformative benefits of the programs offered at our farm and how our special animals and beautiful land impact the lives of Meridian's clients and everyone who comes to the farm! 💚

Main Stay, a fieldwork site for Occupational Therapy Assistant (OTA) students from McHenry County College, welcomes students to the farm in April for one of their clinical rotations. April also happens to be Occupational Therapy Month, a time to recognize OT's and OTA's as they help people participate in meaningful activities. 

Students meet riders and their families, observe and help in classes and learn how impactful riding is for our clients here at the farm and in their everyday lives as they work to achieve their goals. The farm provides a wonderful non-traditional learning environment to see first-hand the value in meaningful activities such as riding, working on life skills and gardening.

#OccupationalTherapyMonth

We want to give a big THANK YOU to our talented rider Lauren and dedicated volunteer Denise J. for painting these beautiful mailboxes for our riders to use in the arena! 

These mailboxes aren’t just cute, they are a wonderful teaching tool and they have a few purposes.

Riders use these as visuals to work on steering and stopping/starting changes of pace. Additionally, things can be hidden inside them so they provide a purposeful way to engage with fine motor skills in the arena – opening/closing doors, pulling things out and utilizing those objects in their lesson such as balls to throw in the basketball hoop, grooming tools to learn about, bean bags to throw etc.

Thank you, Lauren and Denise! 💚

Triple Crown Raffle tickets are NOW ON SALE! https://lnkd.in/gXxg-jiM

This year, you could win $7,500 in cash 🎉no restrictions, no limits, no joke! Just cash in your pocket. 

The best part? We are offering an April Fools’ Day special: TODAY ONLY, buy one ticket and get a second at half price – this is NOT a joke! This special is limited to the first 200 tickets sold – and tickets are selling fast!

Learn more about the Triple Crown Raffle at: https://lnkd.in/ggivGJaR
Every ticket helps empower the children and adults that we serve to reach their highest potential through the infinite restorative abilities of horses, animals and nature, while helping to keep our services accessible to those who need them most.

March is Developmental Disabilities Awareness Month, and this year's theme, "We're Here All Year," says it all.

Individuals with developmental disabilities are not just part of our community one month out of the year; they are the community, every single day.

When individuals with developmental disabilities are given the space to grow, connect, and contribute, the results simply speak for themselves. At the farm, we witness this every day in our programs. Through their unique abilities, they bring creativity, insight, resilience, and joy— not only to our farm but to the entire community.

Awareness is NOT just a month-long campaign. It is an ongoing commitment to ensuring our spaces, programs, and mindsets are inclusive all year-round. It means recognizing that social-emotional learning, connection, and support are not extras… they are essentials. 

Because when everyone is empowered to reach their full potential, we all thrive. 💚

Become a sponsor today at: https://lnkd.in/ggyZZrQs 

Main Stay’s highly anticipated Come Together Gala returns on Thursday, June 26, 2025, from 5:30–9:30 p.m. at the farm! We are currently seeking sponsors for this historically sold-out event—a great opportunity to make a meaningful impact while gaining valuable brand exposure. 

Sponsoring this event allows business leaders to show their support for Main Stay’s vital programs while connecting with hundreds of community members who share a passion for our mission. Your partnership helps ensure that our services remain accessible to those who need them most. 

Learn more about our sponsorship opportunities, which suit various levels of support: https://lnkd.in/gBu4ApvH

If you are a business who is interested in learning more, please contact Main Stay’s communications manager, Randi, at rmurawski@mainstayfarm.org or call 815-653-9374.

Over the past year, she has made big strides in strength and communication, even returning to trotting again during her lessons. Her instructor Haley shared:

“I have loved watching Leah get stronger over the past year! She is strong enough to stay centered and balanced enough that we have been able to trot again during lessons! Leah has also been talking more, letting the leader know the color of the next pole or cone and even letting us know who is singing next in The Lion King! I'm excited that the weather is getting nice again, because she loves to ride outside and steer Harry over the tracks!"

Despite the frustration of not always being able to express herself verbally, it is the kindness and love that Leah receives that keeps her moving to new heights. Like her favorite Disney princesses, Leah carries a magic all her own - a spirit that speaks louder than words ever could.

Learn more about Leah, and see her, for her at: https://lnkd.in/deHYFJQA

Main Stay, a fieldwork site for Occupational Therapy Assistant (OTA) students from McHenry County College, welcomes students to the farm in April for one of their clinical rotations. April also happens to be Occupational Therapy Month, a time to recognize OT's and OTA's as they help people participate in meaningful activities. 

Students meet riders and their families, observe and help in classes and learn how impactful riding is for our clients here at the farm and in their everyday lives as they work to achieve their goals. The farm provides a wonderful non-traditional learning environment to see first-hand the value in meaningful activities such as riding, working on life skills and gardening.

#OccupationalTherapyMonth

We want to give a big THANK YOU to our talented rider Lauren and dedicated volunteer Denise J. for painting these beautiful mailboxes for our riders to use in the arena! 

These mailboxes aren’t just cute, they are a wonderful teaching tool and they have a few purposes.

Riders use these as visuals to work on steering and stopping/starting changes of pace. Additionally, things can be hidden inside them so they provide a purposeful way to engage with fine motor skills in the arena – opening/closing doors, pulling things out and utilizing those objects in their lesson such as balls to throw in the basketball hoop, grooming tools to learn about, bean bags to throw etc.

Thank you, Lauren and Denise! 💚

March is Developmental Disabilities Awareness Month, and this year's theme, "We're Here All Year," says it all.

Individuals with developmental disabilities are not just part of our community one month out of the year; they are the community, every single day.

When individuals with developmental disabilities are given the space to grow, connect, and contribute, the results simply speak for themselves. At the farm, we witness this every day in our programs. Through their unique abilities, they bring creativity, insight, resilience, and joy— not only to our farm but to the entire community.

Awareness is NOT just a month-long campaign. It is an ongoing commitment to ensuring our spaces, programs, and mindsets are inclusive all year-round. It means recognizing that social-emotional learning, connection, and support are not extras… they are essentials. 

Because when everyone is empowered to reach their full potential, we all thrive. 💚

Become a sponsor today at: https://lnkd.in/ggyZZrQs 

Main Stay’s highly anticipated Come Together Gala returns on Thursday, June 26, 2025, from 5:30–9:30 p.m. at the farm! We are currently seeking sponsors for this historically sold-out event—a great opportunity to make a meaningful impact while gaining valuable brand exposure. 

Sponsoring this event allows business leaders to show their support for Main Stay’s vital programs while connecting with hundreds of community members who share a passion for our mission. Your partnership helps ensure that our services remain accessible to those who need them most. 

Learn more about our sponsorship opportunities, which suit various levels of support: https://lnkd.in/gBu4ApvH

If you are a business who is interested in learning more, please contact Main Stay’s communications manager, Randi, at rmurawski@mainstayfarm.org or call 815-653-9374.

Looking back on an incredible event and oh, what a weekend it was! On Friday, February 21, to Sunday, February 23, Main Stay had the honor of hosting the PATH Intl. Region 7 Conference, welcoming over 100 attendees to the farm for a weekend filled with continued education, networking, and collaboration in the field of equine and animal-assisted services.

This event would not have been possible without the dedication of our incredible staff, who went above and beyond to ensure a successful conference. A huge THANK YOU to our amazing volunteers — your hard work and commitment made this conference truly special for everyone invovled!

We are also grateful to our presenters for sharing their knowledge and expertise, making this a valuable experience for all. Special thanks to BetterImpact for sponsoring our snack and coffee breaks and to Main Stay volunteer, Denise Jordan, for providing thoughtful gifts for our presenters!

It took a lot of work to bring this event to life, but seeing it all come together was incredibly rewarding for all of us here at the farm. Thank you to everyone who played a part in making this conference a success! 💚
